segment.source: Protect company data on personal Windows 10 devices with Enterprise Data Protection in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Protect company data on personal Windows 10 devices with Enterprise Data Protection in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Protect company data on personal Windows 10 devices with Enterprise Data Protection in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Protect company data on personal Windows 10 devices with Enterprise Data Protection in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: With the increase of employee-owned devices in the enterprise, there’s also an increasing risk of accidental data disclosure through apps and services that are outside of the enterprise’s control like email, social media, and the public cloud.
segment.target: With the increase of employee-owned devices in the enterprise, there’s also an increasing risk of accidental data disclosure through apps and services that are outside of the enterprise’s control like email, social media, and the public cloud.

segment.source: Many of the existing solutions that try to address this issue require employees to switch between personal and work containers and apps , leading to a less than optimal user experience.
segment.target: Many of the existing solutions that try to address this issue require employees to switch between personal and work containers and apps , leading to a less than optimal user experience.

segment.source: The feature code-named Enterprise Data Protection (EDP) offers a better user experience, while helping to better separate and protect enterprise apps and data against disclosure risks across both company and personal devices, without requiring a change in environment.
segment.target: The feature code-named Enterprise Data Protection (EDP) offers a better user experience, while helping to better separate and protect enterprise apps and data against disclosure risks across both company and personal devices, without requiring a change in environment.

segment.source: EDP helps address your everyday challenges in the enterprise, helping you:
segment.target: EDP helps address your everyday challenges in the enterprise, helping you:

segment.source: Avoid potentially negative employee experiences because of your severely restrictive data protection policies.
segment.target: Avoid potentially negative employee experiences because of your severely restrictive data protection policies.

segment.source: Maintain the privacy of your enterprise data.
segment.target: Maintain the privacy of your enterprise data.

segment.source: Manage apps that aren’t policy-aware, especially on mobile devices.
segment.target: Manage apps that aren’t policy-aware, especially on mobile devices.

segment.source: Feel more confident about the safety of your enterprise data on employee-owned devices by helping to prevent the accidental release of info.
segment.target: Feel more confident about the safety of your enterprise data on employee-owned devices by helping to prevent the accidental release of info.

segment.source: Before you start
segment.target: Before you start

segment.source: Before you can use Microsoft Intune to create, manage, and deploy your EDP policy, you must make sure you are managing Windows 10 devices that have been enrolled with .
segment.target: Before you can use Microsoft Intune to create, manage, and deploy your EDP policy, you must make sure you are managing Windows 10 devices that have been enrolled with .

segment.source: Create an Enterprise Data Protection policy
segment.target: Create an Enterprise Data Protection policy

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Overview > Add Policy.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Overview > Add Policy.

segment.source: Click Windows > Enterprise Data Protection (Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile and later) and then click Create Policy.
segment.target: Click Windows > Enterprise Data Protection (Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile and later) and then click Create Policy.

segment.source: In the General section of the Create Policy page, specify a name and a description for the new policy.
segment.target: In the General section of the Create Policy page, specify a name and a description for the new policy.

segment.source: In the Protected apps section, you can configure a list of apps whose data you would like to protect.
segment.target: In the Protected apps section, you can configure a list of apps whose data you would like to protect.

segment.source: Access to Enterprise network locations are restricted to apps that you configure in the protect apps list.
segment.target: Access to Enterprise network locations are restricted to apps that you configure in the protect apps list.

segment.source: Data accessed by apps in this list are encrypted and users are restricted from relocating data out of protected apps.
segment.target: Data accessed by apps in this list are encrypted and users are restricted from relocating data out of protected apps.

segment.source: To add apps to the “Protected apps” list
segment.target: To add apps to the “Protected apps” list
